communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Facility operating budgets
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

The SFY 2024–25 facility operating budgets of every DOCCS facility.

By “facility operating budget,” I mean the spending plans or allocations of operating funds for individual facilities. DOCCS’s own directives indicate such records are maintained, including:
• Directive 2700 (Budget & Finance), which describes a department-wide spending plan that divides funds among facilities and regions; and
• Directive 2915, which refers to facility operating funds and purchases funded from the facility’s operating budget.

If no “budget” record exists at the facility level, please provide the facility-level operating expenditure (actuals) reports for the same year.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Akash Mehta

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Pulte AP/ProPublica
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all written or electronic communication, including emails, text messages, Signal chats, Twitter/X direct messages, and other electronic messages, sent or received by Bill Pulte since September 1 and that contain one or more of the following key words or phrases: "ProPublica", "Associated Press", "AP", in reference to the Associated Press, "Zeldin", "Chavez", "Duffy", and/or "Dad".

I am a reporter with The Nation and other outlets and seek a fee waiver. If that waiver is denied I am willing to pay up to $25/

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimmy Tobias
